clustering package¶

Submodules¶

clustering.clustering_evaluation module¶

class clustering.clustering_evaluation.Evaluator¶

Bases: object

get_purity_score(dataset, feat_vecs, max_number_clusters=14)¶
Parameters

  • dataset – dataframe containing the chexpert csv

  • feat_vecs – (n x m) matrix where n is the number of images and m is the size of vector representing each image

  • max_number_clusters – number of clusters to examine

Returns

x,y set of coordinates where a y represents the purity score and x the number of clusters examined for a particular y

get_silhouette_score(feat_vecs, max_number_clusters=14)¶
Parameters

  • feat_vecs – (n x m) matrix where n is the number of images and m is the size of vector representing each image

  • max_number_clusters – number of clusters to examine

Returns

x,y set of coordinates where a y represents the silhoutte score and x the number of clusters examined for a particular y

class clustering.clustering_pipeline.ClusteringPipeline(root, path_to_pretrained_chexpert_model, CSVPATH, chexnet_targets, n_images, height=224, width=224, n_channels=3)¶

Bases: object

build_2d_clusters(n_clusters)¶

Extracts features from images, reduce their dimensionality to 2 and visualise them :param n_clusters: number of clusters to produce :return:

build_3d_clusters(n_clusters)¶

Extracts features from images, reduce their dimensionality to 3 and visualise them :param n_clusters: number of clusters to produce :return:

get_dataset()¶
Returns

pandas.Dataframe representing the dataset uploaded

get_feature_vectors()¶
Returns

feature vectors extracted from images size (N X M) where N is the number of images and M is the dimensionality of the features extracted

class clustering.clustering_visualiser.ClusteringVisualiser(chexpert_dataframe)¶

Bases: object

visualise_2d(reduced_feat_vecs, cluster_labels)¶

2D visualisation of reduced_feat_vecs :param reduced_feat_vecs: numpy array size (N X 2) where N is the number of coordinates to be visualised :param cluster_labels: numpy array size N :return:

visualise_3d(reduced_feat_vecs, cluster_labels)¶

3D visualisation of reduced_feat_vecs :param reduced_feat_vecs: numpy array size (N X 3) where N is the number of coordinates to be visualised :param cluster_labels: numpy array size N :return:

clustering.dataset_loader module¶

class clustering.dataset_loader.ChexpertDatasetLoader(targets)¶

Bases: object

get_dataset(CSVPATH, number_of_rows)¶

Returns a dataframe containing the chexpert csv uploaded from PATH. Final column is appended with ‘positive’ indicating all pathologies present delimited by a semicolon. :param CSVPATH: path to chexpert csv :param number_of_rows: number of rows in the csv to return :return:

class clustering.model_loader.ChexpertModelLoader(path_to_pretrained_chexpert_model, height, width, channels)¶

Bases: object

get_model()¶

returns the output just before the fully connected layer of the chexpert model loaded through path_to_pretrained_chexpert_model :return:
